channel.title: BBC News - UK Politics
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Boris Johnson resisted autumn lockdown as only over-80s dying - Dominic Cummings
item.description: Boris Johnson also questioned whether the NHS would be overwhelmed, his former aide tells the BBC.

item.title: David Cameron lacked judgement over Greensill, MPs' report says
item.description: David Cameron showed a lack of judgement when he informally lobbied on behalf of Greensill Capital, MPs say.

item.title: Tony Blair's Irish Famine message not signed off by him, archive papers show
item.description: Files show the former PM's private secretary wrote the statement but could not reach him for approval.

item.title: Plans to modernise power of attorney system
item.description: People can put someone in charge of their affairs but the process is criticised for being slow to enact.

item.title: Council algorithms mass profile millions, campaigners say
item.description: Most of the software is "secret, unevidenced, invasive and likely discriminatory", Big Brother Watch says.

item.title: Covid: Lifting all restrictions at once is reckless, says Sir Keir Starmer
item.description: Boris Johnson has urged caution as most legal rules on social contact are lifted in England.

item.title: Covid: Isolation rules loosened for critical workers
item.description: People performing "critical" tasks including air traffic controllers will still be able to work under new rules.

item.title: Labour: Why would we oppose a social care tax?
item.description: But the shadow health secretary says he would want a guarantee the money would be used for care.

item.title: Covid-19: PM and chancellor self-isolate after rapid U-turn
item.description: It comes after anger over "VIP testing" allowing them to work following Sajid Javid's positive test.

item.title: Covid: Hundreds of thousands of under-18s to get vaccine
item.description: The vaccines minister says children at high risk from Covid will be offered the jab.

item.title: Brexit: DUP leader calls for renegotiation of Brexit deal
item.description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson was speaking after meeting the European Commission vice president on Monday.

item.title: Government set to lay out plans for abortion in NI
item.description: The commissioning of abortion services in Northern Ireland has stalled at the executive level.

item.title: Covid: Fully jabbed arrivals from France must still quarantine
item.description: A planned relaxation of England's rules from Monday will not apply due to cases of the Beta variant.

item.title: Brexit: Supermarkets warn of rising costs due to NI Protocol
item.description: Supermarket chains say retailers may be forced to switch from British suppliers to EU suppliers.

item.title: Blackpool councillor 'fat shamed' by MP over critical tweet
item.description: A Blackpool councillor claims a comment one of the town's MPs made in reply to his tweet was "nasty".

item.title: Ruth Davidson to join House of Lords on Tuesday
item.description: The former Scottish Conservative leader will take the title Baroness Davidson of Lundin Links.

item.title: NHS: Tredegar building to tell story of Aneurin Bevan's inspiration
item.description: Tredegar Medical Aid Society was used as a blueprint by NHS founder Aneurin Bevan.

item.title: I will sweat blood to win voters' respect, says Sir Keir Starmer
item.description: The Labour leader tells the BBC his party has a "trust issue", after talking to some of its ex-voters.

item.title: UK looks to extend ivory ban to hippos and other animals
item.description: Ministers say elephants are not the only animals at risk from hunters, as they launch consultation.

item.title: Boris Johnson's university friend gets ethics watchdog role
item.description: Labour accuses Boris Johnson of "cronyism" but the government says proper processes were followed.

item.title: GB News says presenter Guto Harri breached standards by taking the knee
item.description: Guto Harri is not expected to appear for the rest of the summer after making the gesture on air.

item.title: Foreign aid: Government facing legal action over £4bn cuts
item.description: A UK-based charity argues a legally-binding target must be changed before spending can be reduced.

item.title: Homes raided in inquiry into Matt Hancock CCTV leak
item.description: Investigators want to know who obtained images of the ex-minister kissing an aide in his office.

item.title: Colum Eastwood: MP reveals death threats after naming Soldier F
item.description: Colum Eastwood named the former paratrooper, accused of two Bloody Sunday murders, in Parliament.

item.title: NI Troubles: 'Robust conversation' as parties meet Lewis over legacy
item.description: The UK proposals have been widely rejected by the executive parties, Irish government and victims.

item.title: Barnard Castle: Cummings challenged over lockdown trip to Durham
item.description: BBC Political Editor Laura Kuenssberg challenges Dominic Cummings on his Rose Garden press conference.

item.title: PM wanted to meet Queen face-to-face at start of pandemic
item.description: Former Downing Street aide Dominic Cummings says Boris Johnson wanted to meet the Queen in person at the start of the pandemic.

item.title: Boris Johnson 'put his own interests ahead of people's lives'
item.description: Former Downing Street aide Dominic Cummings says the PM put his own political interests ahead of saving lives.

item.title: Boris Johnson: Full vaccination will be required to enter nightclubs
item.description: By the end of September, "proof of a negative test will no longer be enough," says the prime minister.

item.title: Johnson and Sunak tried to dodge isolation - Starmer
item.description: The Labour leader accuses the pair of claiming to have been "miraculously selected" for a testing scheme.

item.title: Coventry City of Culture: The women who helped shape a 'city of justice'
item.description: Coventry women have always been at the heart of the struggle for social justice, a historian says.

item.title: PMQs: What did Boris Johnson say about the booing of England players?
item.description: Labour challenged the prime minister over his position on those who booed England when they "took the knee".

item.title: Foreign aid: Who will be hit by the UK government cuts?
item.description: The UK government is reducing its spending this year on foreign aid - with major consequences for some recipients.

item.title: What more can be done to stop racist abuse online?
item.description: Abuse directed at England footballers has prompted calls for more action to tackle hate online.

item.title: Are lots of people deleting the NHS Covid app?
item.description: Are people using the government's Covid app or are they deleting it?

item.title: Covid: Will free school meals continue over summer holidays?
item.description: A year on from Marcus Rashford's successful campaign, what is the current situation?

item.title: Does political pressure shape pandemic decisions?
item.description: With Scotland and England on the road out of lockdown, does political pressure encourage a "four nation" approach?

item.title: Ministers see off MPs' attempts to amend new crime bill
item.description: MPs have approved controversial new public order laws but ministers signal concessions to come.
